column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
pwwpea, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have used this drug only after very active, physicaly demanding days because I do not like to take pills. One at the end of that day and one the next morning gets me to be able to function fairly easily. I am of the mentallity that if I had no pain, I would deffinitely over do it. This takes most pain away with little to no side affects.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medication has not been useful due to the fact that it has not stopped the pain.  Directions from the doctor states it should be taken by mouth every 6 hours as needed.  Over the counter medications have done just as well.

column2: rfox6, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: other than constipation I have had no issues with Tramadol

column2: ahardwick, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was given Tramadol to help with my lower back pain.  I can only take this drug at night because it makes me very sleepy.  It does help with my back pain and gives me a restful night but, as mentioned earlier, I can ONLY take it at night.

column2: XOJJ3E3, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
john, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
Pam, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was taking 6 pills a day. I started feeling like I was getting panic attacks and shakes.  I cut the dose way back and the panic attacks have stopped. But now I am left with a high amount of pain for my back condition.

column2: Menchaca, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It worked on my nerves before I had pain relief, redirects my brain, but I did have on and off dizzy spells and quick thoughts racings faster than I could speak. Do not drive and make sure you eat well. tends too decrease appetite, and increase thirst with some imbalance.  Yet, very alert. takes at least and hour and one-half for pain to start to minimize. Muscles will relax suddenly to where you may walk and talk as if you are drunk at this point you must  have bed rest to avoid any injury. no other medication is needed and be sure to have any other medication out of your system before starting.

column2: 55-64 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column9: Take mainly for neck and back pain.  It has not caused and interaction with my other medications. Very seldom do I have to take more than 2 tablets and I am very satisfied with this medication.

column9: I have been taking this for a few weeks and it really isn't all that good. I was on Percocet and wanted to change to a non-narcotic. So far I am not really happy as it isn't doing much to help the pain.

column2: m6lfdj, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I get very bad headaches and Tramadol takes the edge off the headache.

column2: patricia, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: i've tried many pain medications and tramol seems to help more than others of course there are days when nothing seems to help but mostly regular doses keep me able to do everyday things

column2: chronic pain, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was put on tramadol about a month after surgery on my lower back.  I had been on oxycodone before that.  The oxycodone worked fine but the doctor didn't want me to stay on that.  Thanks to that because the Tramadol was superior.  The Tramadol relieved almost all the pain and still let me maintain function.

column2: vic, 55-64 Male  (Patient)
dab, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i pulled muscles in my back in which this drug has helped to relief my pain and also has helped my sleep.i have a history of breaking out with large hives.this medicine didnt affect me in that way.it helps!

column2: justin_tyme_911, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am a diabetic suffering from severe nerve pain in my legs and feet. While placed on a regimine of 2 50mg tablets three times a day, I have been relatively pain free. I was unable to take any medications with Tylenol and this pain reliever worked great. I am very satisfied with its effectiveness.

column2: 19-24 Female
column9: I took this during a migraine to help reduce the pain. The only thing it helped was to make me fall asleep. Later I woke up with a rash over my entire body and severe itching that continued for over 24 hours.
